page.title: 09Comparing Two Estates
page.content: The following data was co-ordinated following the completion of a questionnaire by adults from 50 homes on a Suburban Estate{(Thornes Moor {Road)}and 50 homes on an Outer City Council Estate{(Portobello). On both estates the population surveyed was 100% British born. There was no appreciable difference in age structure. On the suburban estate all houses were owner-occupied with hot water, bath, W.C., cooker, fridge, washer, T.V., vacuum and central heating. 88% owned a car, 94% a garage, 80% a freezer, 46% a food processor, 32% a micro-wave oven and 36% owned video recorders. 78% of those employed worked in Wakefield. Of those employed 73% were engaged in professional, managerial, skilled or non-manual occupations. Only 2% were unemployed.
